required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Determinants and Within-subject Variability of Maximal Fat Oxidation During Exercise in Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Determinants and Within-subject Variability of Maximal Fat Oxidation During Exercise in Adults

brief_summary.textblock:
The ability to upregulate fat oxidation at appropriate times such as during fasting, low to moderate intensity exercise and after a high fat meal, is an important marker of health and a determinant of optimal endurance performance.
Maximal fat oxidation reportedly occurs at an exercise intensity between 45 - 65% of maximal oxygen capacity with large between-subject variability apparent. Numerous factors have been associated with maximal fat oxidation, but a large amount of variance remains unexplained. Additionally, the within-subject variability of maximal fat oxidation has not been systematically evaluated, but may partially account for the reported between-subject variability and thus, only once measured can determinants of maximal fat oxidation be more precisely determined.
The investigators want to further explore determinants of and investigate the within-subject variability of fat oxidation during exercise in a wide range of 'healthy' and 'at risk of metabolic disease' adults. By investigating these processes this work will explore how nutrition and exercise can be optimised to improve health and weight loss.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximal rate of whole-body fat oxidation (mg/kg FFM/min)
primary_outcome.description: Fat free mass (FFM). Assessed during the incremental stage maximal cardio-respiratory fitness test

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximal rate of whole-body fat oxidation (g/min)
secondary_outcome.description: Non-adjusted rate. Assessed during the incremental stage maximal cardio-respiratory fitness test
Assessed during the incremental stage maximal cardio-respiratory fitness test

secondary_outcome.measure: Whole-body substrate oxidation rates (Carbohydrates and Lipid)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed during the incremental stage maximal cardio-respiratory fitness test
Assessed during the incremental stage maximal cardio-respiratory fitness test
Assessed via a weighed food diary (completed for the immediate three days prior to each study day)
Assessed objectively via an Actiheart monitor (worn for the immediate three days prior to each study day)
Assessed through a self-reported menstrual cycle questionnaire
Assessed by the International Physical Activity Questionnaire (long form)

secondary_outcome.measure: Fasting Adipose tissue derived hormone concentrations (leptin, adiponectin)
Fasting sex hormone concentrations (17 beta-estradiol, testosterone, progesterone)
Fasting pancreatic derived hormone concentrations (insulin and glucagon)

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed via analysis of urine sample with a refractometer

secondary_outcome.measure: Dietary pattern / requirements (e.g. vegetarian, vegan, Celiac disease)

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed via skinfold measurements at following sites: Tricep, Bicep, Subscapular, Iliac Crest

intervention.description: Participants will complete two identical study protocols 7 - 14 days apart which includes: A study day (max. 2 hours) involving an incremental stage maximal cardiorespiratory fitness test Activity and Dietary monitoring for the immediate three days prior to study day Maintenance of habitual habits, dietary and physical activity behaviour patterns We are observing biological / health parameters in a group of individuals who perform an incremental-stage exercise test twice. The current study does not involve an intervention.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- be between 18 - 65 years of age
- male or female
- body mass index between 18.9 - 35 kg/m2
- be able and willing to give informed oral and written consent
- complete and meet the defined criteria of pre-study questionnaires and screens
Exclusion Criteria:
- Currently have or have a previous history of metabolic, cardio-pulmonary or musculoskeletal disease
- BMI below 18.9 or above 35 kg/m2
- Have plans to change lifestyle (diet and/or physical activity) during the study period ( 7 - 21 days)
- Failure or do not agree to refrain from alcohol and strenuous exercise one day before or during trial days

facility.name: Department for Health, University of Bath

reference.citation: Venables MC, Achten J, Jeukendrup AE. Determinants of fat oxidation during exercise in healthy men and women: a cross-sectional study. J Appl Physiol (1985). 2005 Jan;98(1):160-7. Epub 2004 Aug 27.
